intro: Pilosella ziziana subsp. affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its small size and delicate appearance make it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
